mission.title: Our Mission
mission.subtitle: Building a future where technology serves humanity, not the other way around
mission.description: Born from the hacker ethos and IRC culture that built the early internet, we believe in radical transparency, collaborative innovation, and the fundamental right to free and open information. While others abandoned their principles for profit, we hold fast to a simple truth: technology should empower everyone, not just the few.

vision.title: Vision
vision.content: A world where AI systems are transparent, the internet remains free and open, and technology amplifies human potential rather than replacing it. We envision collaborative AI that respects privacy, promotes creativity, and serves the global commons.

values.title: Radical Openness
values.description: Every line of code, every research paper, every breakthrough. Open source isn't just our method, it's our philosophy. Information wants to be free.

values.title: Hacker Ethics
values.description: Access to computers and anything that might teach you something about how the world works should be unlimited and total. Always yield to the hands-on imperative.

values.title: Internet Freedom
values.description: The internet was built by hackers, for everyone. We fight against surveillance capitalism, data hoarding, and the corporate capture of digital spaces.

values.title: Human-Centric AI
values.description: We build AI that augments human intelligence rather than replacing it. Technology should expand what humans can do, not make them obsolete.

values.title: Collaborative Spirit
values.description: Like the IRC channels where ideas flowed freely, we believe the best innovations emerge from open collaboration across boundaries.

values.title: Production Reality
values.description: Our research isn't just academic, it's battle-tested in real systems. We bridge the gap between theory and practice.

values.title: Digital Sovereignty
values.description: Users should control their own data, algorithms, and digital experiences. We reject the surveillance economy and build tools for self-determination.

values.title: Tinkerer's Mindset
values.description: Take it apart, figure out how it works, make it better. The hacker spirit of curiosity and creative destruction drives everything we do.

goals: Advance understanding of multi-agent AI interactions and emergent behaviors
Develop ethical frameworks that prioritize human agency and digital rights
Create open-source tools that democratize AI research and development
Preserve the free and open internet against corporate enclosure
Foster a new generation of hackers, researchers, and digital rights advocates
Bridge academic research with real-world production challenges
Build AI systems that respect privacy, creativity, and human autonomy
